basics.name: Martina Lucà
basics.label: Computational Biologist
basics.summary: My journey started with the bachelor’s degree in biotechnology and the master’s degree in molecular and medical biotechnology. During these studies I discovered my passion for bioinformatics applied to genomics. My goal is to deepen my knowledge in this field as much as possible and to blend my passion for biology with the one for computer science.

work.name: Applied Research Center ARC-NET "Miriam Cherubini Loro"
work.summary: Development, maintenance and update of a pipeline for the analysis of genomic panels.

work.name: University of Verona
work.summary: Study of the Prefix-Free Parsing Algorithm. In particular, I focused on the evaluation of the importance of the choice of parameters (modulo m and window size w) and the impact they have on the dimension of the final Dictionary and Parse. To do so I used as datasets a series of genomics libraries, both real and artificially created in way that allowed me to control the within sequence similarity of the collection and to evaluate its impact on the dimension of Dictionary and Parse.

work.name: University of Verona
work.summary: The objective of the internship was to deepen the knowledge about text indexes and to improve programming abilities. In particular, I focused on the optimization of the Binary Search phase (using LCP and RMQs) in the context of a larger algorithm for the calculation of Matching Statistics. The results were submitted at an international conference.

work.name: University of Verona
work.summary: Tutor for students with learning disabilities and administrative office work at the Inclusion and Accessibility Office of the University.

work.name: University of Insubria
work.summary: Analysis of the osteological finds recovered in the crypt of the Church of Santa Maria Maggiore in Vercelli with the objective of obtaning as much in- formation as possible regarding the population found e of analyzing what can be found in a similar archeological context. To reach such objectives, the biological profile of each find was reconstructed; also the events, both of pathological and taphonomic nature, that led to the current state of conservation of each find were recontructed.

work.name: University of Insubria
work.summary: Tutor for students with learning disabilities, administrative office work and student orientation.

work.name: Polytechnic University of Milan
work.summary: Internship focused on providing the basics of Python programming of the use of Arduino.

volunteer.summary: I volunteer mainly in the societal field (organizing the warehouse, distribution of food, food collection, grocery shopping service for the elders, ...). I'm currently enrolled in the course for the OPEM title (Emergency Operator).

courses: Parameters for Prefix-Free Parsing: Analysis and Experimentation
Bioarcheological analysis of the osteological finds from the crypt of the Church of Santa Maria Maggiore in Vercelli

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

publications.name: Fast matching statistics for long similar strings
publications.publisher: Zsuzsanna Lipták, Martina Lucà, Francesco Masillo, Simon J. Puglisi

skills.name: Informatic Skills
keywords: Programming (C++, Python, R, Bash, Git, html/css, LaTeX, markdown)

skills.name: Biological Skills
keywords: Isolation of nucleic acids (RNA) and proteins
Toxicity assays on cell cultures and zebrafish embryos

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
